Constructor Detail

Gui

public Gui()
The constructur of the Gui initialises counters, listeners and the timer. The GUI is not configured after the constructor finishes. Use the method init() to initialize the gui. And run() after that to run the gui, until it will be disposed.

Method Detail

unsubscribe

protected boolean unsubscribe(java.lang.String gcm,
                              int port)

subscribe

private boolean subscribe(java.lang.String gcm,
                          int port)

deleteAllNotifications

protected void deleteAllNotifications(java.lang.String gcm)

updateOverlay

private void updateOverlay(java.lang.String overlayMessageToAdd)

stopRecorder

private void stopRecorder(MotionRecorder recorder)

changeFSMenu

private void changeFSMenu()
This method changes from MODE2 to MODE3 and vice versa. So it enables or disables the menu in the fullscreen mode of the gui

configureGUI

private void configureGUI(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
This method creates the GUI with StackLayouts for all 3 modes.

Parameters:
shell - the shell used as parent for the whole application

setBackground

private void setBackground(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
This method makes the gui a lot nicer and sets a nice background to all composites used in this gui

Parameters:
shell - the shell where the background should be set

refreshBackground

private void refreshBackground(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
This method recalculates the background. Normally used when a resze event occured

Parameters:
shell - the shell used to refresh the background on

addButtons

private void addButtons(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
Adds the menu to the given composite with centralized buttons to control the recorder. side effect: the composite menuBarDefaultComp is set so that the menubar can easily be connected/disconnected to this composit

Parameters:
parent - the parent composite where the menu-buttons should be added

handleConnectionError

private void handleConnectionError(java.lang.Exception e)

addPreferenceButtons

private void addPreferenceButtons(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite comp)
Adds prefernce buttons to the given composite

Parameters:
comp - used as parent for the preference buttons

addHiddenField

private void addHiddenField(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite comp)
creates a hidden field on the given Composite. This field is to be used in a GridLayout and grabs horizontal space

Parameters:
comp - Composite, where the hidden field should be created at

createMenubarComposit

private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite createMenubarComposit(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
This method is used for creating the menu bar that can be moved around

Parameters:
parent - the parent, where the composite for the menubar should be created
Returns:
Composite return the created menubar composite

createVideoWindow

private void createVideoWindow(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                               java.lang.Object layoutData)
This method is used to create a Video window with the given layoutData for the parent composite on the given parent. As side effects are the variables defaultVidComp and vid set to the created composite and video component.

Parameters:
parent - defines the place where the video window is added
layoutData - defines how the window behaves in the parent layout

createFullScreenPlace

private void createFullScreenPlace(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
Creates one composite as container for the two different Composites for the fullscreen. They can be switched also using the StackLayout of SWT. Side effects: 1. changes the variable fsComp to the StackLayout-Composite of the fullscreen mode. 2. sets the composite menuBarFSComp that is used to connect the menubar to.

Parameters:
shell - the parent, where the fullscreen composite should be added

addDefaultScreen

private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite addDefaultScreen(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell)
Adds the default screen for MODE1 to the given shell. Does not set buttons, because first the video window have to be added.

Parameters:
shell - parent used for the creation of this composite
Returns:
the created composite with a gridlayout with 1 column. (like row, but different sizes per row possible)

changeFullScreen

private void changeFullScreen()
If in Fullscreen mode, will this method change to default mode MODE1. If in default mode, it will change to the last seen FullScreen Mode. MODE2 or MODE3. On first call changes to MODE2 (without menu)

setCapturingPath

private boolean setCapturingPath()
trys to get the capturing paths

Returns:
if the setting of the capturing path was successfull

startServer

private boolean startServer()
                     throws java.io.IOException
Start/restart the recorder. After that the webcame is played, but nothing recorded.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

setButtonsStarted

private void setButtonsStarted()

stopServer

private void stopServer()
stops the server. This will stop the connectionManager and every running pipe. It will also disconnect the video component from the current displaying pipe.

setButtonsStopped

private void setButtonsStopped()

run

public void run()
Runs the gui, until it is closed by a user. This Method will first return, when the window is disposed Will fail, if the GUI was not initialized by using the method init().

init

public void init()
Initializes all the GUI parts and has to be called before using the run() method. Will also set the display variable in this gui.

setShowFPS

private void setShowFPS(boolean useFPS)
Changes depending on the given boolean the overlay of the video component and shows/disables the FPS in the video part of the gui.

Parameters:
useFPS - boolean to set fps as overlay if true, or disables fps if false
